titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. Whereas an humble address hath been made unto us by Our Commons assembled in Parliament ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill deceas'd, and by Henry Hills and Thomas Newcomb, Printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty ;
Re-printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to his most sacred Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Promises a reward of one thousand pounds for the return of James, Duke of Monmouth, dead or alive.
Dated at end: Given at Our Court at Whitehall the sixteenth day of June, 1685. In the first year of Our Reign.
Imperfect: stained and torn with some loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
